thread.title: No way: Poll shows some people think the North East is in the South!

author: Mike Fuller
title: No way: Poll shows some people think the North East is in the South!
text:
Get daily     
The North-South divide debate rages on and it turns out people have some interesting opinions. 
A YouGov survey of almost 8,000 people which was published on Thursday has re-ignited the discussion. 
Surely the North East is part of the North? It is in the name, but not everyone agrees as close to 10% gave a different answer. 
Across the 7,963 English adults who responded to the survey, 91% said the North East is part of the North and bizarrely 1% said it was in the South. Where does the North-South divide in England lie? (Image: Trinity Mirror) 
A further 5% claimed it was neither and 3% said they did not know. 
Among the 385 people from the North East who were asked, the figures were generally similar as 91% agreed it was in the North, 1% said the South and 1% did not know. Read More The North-South divide isn’t a modern thing - the Vikings are to blame 
There was an increase to 8% in those who said it was neither. 
Respondents were shown a map of England with regional boundaries and each of the nine regions unnamed but labelled A-I. 
Where should the dividing line be drawn? Does it depend on whether you say ‘bath’ or ‘barth’? 
The vast majority agreed the North West as well as Yorkshire and Humberside were also part of the North. Read More Minister assures North East over post-Brexit cash to help make up for lost EU millions 
The most popular answer for the West and East Midlands was neither and there was a debate as to whether the East was also in this category, but a small majority said it was in the South. 
London, the South East and South West were all heavily favoured as part of the South. Although 3% claimed London was in fact in the North. Like us on Facebook
